meanings.definition: Having the form of a cylinder.
meanings.sent1: The lampshade was a cylindrical shape.
meanings.sent2: The pencil was cylindrical in design.
meanings.sent3: The cake was baked in a cylindrical pan, making it look like a giant donut.
meanings.sent4: The skyscraper rose up like a cylindrical tower in the city skyline.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut marveled at the cylindrical shape of the rocket before takeoff.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a cylinder.
meanings.sent1: The cylindrical engine part needed replacement.
meanings.sent2: The cylindrical container held the precious documents.
meanings.sent3: The cylindrical lock clicked shut, securing the door.
meanings.sent4: The cylindrical pipe carried water to the fields.
meanings.sent5: The cylindrical base provided stability to the structure.

meanings.sent1: The tree trunk was cylindrical and tall.
meanings.sent2: The vase had a cylindrical body with a narrow neck.
meanings.sent3: The cylindrical pillow rolled off the bed and onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: The cylindrical column supported the weight of the building.
meanings.sent5: The cylindrical tunnel led deep into the mountain.
